title: Bug 49195: Error message printed when using port 1 as shutdown port with Windows service
description: When specifying <Server port="1" in server.xml, an error message is printed when stopping Tomcat after installing it as a Windows service. However, using System.exit(0) works fine for stopping Tomcat in this scenario.
OB: Currently, when stopping Tomcat after installing it as a Windows service and specifying port 1 as the shutdown port in server.xml, an error message is printed.
EB: When stopping Tomcat after installing it as a Windows service and specifying port 1 as the shutdown port in server.xml, no error message should be printed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Install Tomcat as a service on Windows. 
2. Start the service, and then stop the service. 
3. Shutdown the server through an OS signal, for example, by calling Catalina.stop().
